enum  cvmx_tlb_pagemask_t {
  CVMX_TLB_PAGEMASK_4K = 0x3 << 11,
  CVMX_TLB_PAGEMASK_16K = 0xF << 11,
  CVMX_TLB_PAGEMASK_64K = 0x3F << 11,
  CVMX_TLB_PAGEMASK_256K = 0xFF << 11,
  CVMX_TLB_PAGEMASK_1M = 0x3FF << 11,
  CVMX_TLB_PAGEMASK_4M = 0xFFF << 11,
  CVMX_TLB_PAGEMASK_16M = 0x3FFF << 11,

Detailed Description

Module to support operations on core such as TLB config, etc.

Revision
96463

typedef union cvmx_core_perf_control cvmx_core_perf_control_t

Bit description of the COP0 counter control register.

typedef enum cvmx_core_perf cvmx_core_perf_t

The types of performance counters supported per cpu.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum cvmx_core_perf

The types of performance counters supported per cpu.

Enumerator:
CVMX_CORE_PERF_NONE 

Turn off the performance counter.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_CLK 

Conditionally clocked cycles (as opposed to count/cvm_count which count even with no clocks).

CVMX_CORE_PERF_ISSUE 

Instructions issued but not retired.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_RET 

Instructions retired.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_NISSUE 

Cycles no issue.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_SISSUE 

Cycles single issue.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_DISSUE 

Cycles dual issue.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_IFI 

Cycle ifetch issued (but not necessarily commit to pp_mem).

CVMX_CORE_PERF_BR 

Branches retired.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_BRMIS 

Branch mispredicts.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_J 

Jumps retired.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_JMIS 

Jumps mispredicted.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_REPLAY 

Mem Replays.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_IUNA 

Cycles idle due to unaligned_replays.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_TRAP 

trap_6a signal

CVMX_CORE_PERF_UULOAD 

Unexpected unaligned loads (REPUN=1).

CVMX_CORE_PERF_UUSTORE 

Unexpected unaligned store (REPUN=1).

CVMX_CORE_PERF_ULOAD 

Unaligned loads (REPUN=1 or USEUN=1).

CVMX_CORE_PERF_USTORE 

Unaligned store (REPUN=1 or USEUN=1).

CVMX_CORE_PERF_EC 

Exec clocks(must set CvmCtl[DISCE] for accurate timing).

CVMX_CORE_PERF_MC 

Mul clocks(must set CvmCtl[DISCE] for accurate timing).

CVMX_CORE_PERF_CC 

Crypto clocks(must set CvmCtl[DISCE] for accurate timing).

CVMX_CORE_PERF_CSRC 

Issue_csr clocks(must set CvmCtl[DISCE] for accurate timing).

CVMX_CORE_PERF_CFETCH 

Icache committed fetches (demand+prefetch).

CVMX_CORE_PERF_CPREF 

Icache committed prefetches.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_ICA 

Icache aliases.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_II 

Icache invalidates.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_IP 

Icache parity error.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_CIMISS 

Cycles idle due to imiss (must set CvmCtl[DISCE] for accurate timing).

CVMX_CORE_PERF_WBUF 

Number of write buffer entries created.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_WDAT 

Number of write buffer data cycles used (may need to set CvmCtl[DISCE] for accurate counts).

CVMX_CORE_PERF_WBUFLD 

Number of write buffer entries forced out by loads.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_WBUFFL 

Number of cycles that there was no available write buffer entry (may need to set CvmCtl[DISCE] and CvmMemCtl[MCLK] for accurate counts).

CVMX_CORE_PERF_WBUFTR 

Number of stores that found no available write buffer entries.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_BADD 

Number of address bus cycles used (may need to set CvmCtl[DISCE] for accurate counts).

CVMX_CORE_PERF_BADDL2 

Number of address bus cycles not reflected (i.e.

destined for L2) (may need to set CvmCtl[DISCE] for accurate counts)

CVMX_CORE_PERF_BFILL 

Number of fill bus cycles used (may need to set CvmCtl[DISCE] for accurate counts).

CVMX_CORE_PERF_DDIDS 

Number of Dstream DIDs created.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_IDIDS 

Number of Istream DIDs created.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_DIDNA 

Number of cycles that no DIDs were available (may need to set CvmCtl[DISCE] and CvmMemCtl[MCLK] for accurate counts).

CVMX_CORE_PERF_LDS 

Number of load issues.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_LMLDS 

Number of local memory load.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_IOLDS 

Number of I/O load issues.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_DMLDS 

Number of loads that were not prefetches and missed in the cache.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_STS 

Number of store issues.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_LMSTS 

Number of local memory store issues.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_IOSTS 

Number of I/O store issues.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_IOBDMA 

Number of IOBDMAs.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_DTLB 

Number of dstream TLB refill, invalid, or modified exceptions.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_DTLBAD 

Number of dstream TLB address errors.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_ITLB 

Number of istream TLB refill, invalid, or address error exceptions.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_SYNC 

Number of SYNC stall cycles (may need to set CvmCtl[DISCE] for accurate counts).

CVMX_CORE_PERF_SYNCIOB 

Number of SYNCIOBDMA stall cycles (may need to set CvmCtl[DISCE] for accurate counts).

CVMX_CORE_PERF_SYNCW 

Number of SYNCWs.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_DUTLB 

Number of dstream misses in the μTLB.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_IUTLB 

Number of istream misses in the μTLB.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_CDMISS 

Cycles idle due to demand (non-prefetch) Dstream misses.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_ERETMIS 

D/eret mispredicts.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_LIKMIS 

Branch likely mispredicts.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_HAZTR 

Hazard traps due to *MTC0 to CvmCtl, Perf counter control, EntryHi, or CvmMemCtl registers.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_FPUNIMPTRAP 

Number of FP unimplemented traps.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_FPHAZARDTRAP 

Number of FP hazard traps.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_FPARITHEXC 

Number of FP Arithmetic Exceptions.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_FPMOVC1 

Number of retired MTC1, DMTC1, MFHC1, MTHC1, MFC1, DMFC1 instructions.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_FPCOPYC1 

Number of retired CFC1 and CTC1 instructions.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_FPCOMPARE 

Number of retired FP C.Cond.fmt instructions.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_FPBRANCH 

Number of retired BC1T, BC1F, BC1TL, and BC1FL instructions.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_FPMOV 

Number of retired FP move instructions.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_FPABSNEG 

Number of retired FP ABS.fmt and NEG.fmt instructions.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_FPADDSUB 

Number of retired FP ADD.fmt and SUB.fmt instructions.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_FPCVT 

Number of retired FP format conversion instructions (e.g., CVT.S.D).

CVMX_CORE_PERF_FPMUL 

Number of retired FP MUL.fmt instructions.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_FPMADD 

Number of retired FP MADD.fmt variant instructions.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_FPDIVRECIP 

Number of retired FP DIV.fmt and RECIP.fmt instructions.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_FPSQRTRSQRT 

Number of retired FP SQRT.fmt and RSQRT.fmt instructions.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_FPLOAD 

Number of retired FP load instructions.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_FPSTORE 

Number of retired FP store instructions.

CVMX_CORE_PERF_FPALL 

Number of retired FP instructions(all).

CVMX_CORE_PERF_MAX 

This not a counter, just a marker for the highest number.

enum cvmx_tlb_pagemask_t
Enumerator:
CVMX_TLB_PAGEMASK_4K 
CVMX_TLB_PAGEMASK_16K 
CVMX_TLB_PAGEMASK_64K 
CVMX_TLB_PAGEMASK_256K 
CVMX_TLB_PAGEMASK_1M 
CVMX_TLB_PAGEMASK_4M 
CVMX_TLB_PAGEMASK_16M 
CVMX_TLB_PAGEMASK_64M 
CVMX_TLB_PAGEMASK_256M 

Function Documentation

int cvmx_core_add_fixed_tlb_mapping ( uint64_t  vaddr,
uint64_t  page0_addr,
uint64_t  page1_addr,
cvmx_tlb_pagemask_t  page_mask 
)

Adds a fixed (wired) TLB mapping.

Returns TLB index used or -1 on error. Assumes both pages are valid. Use cvmx_core_add_fixed_tlb_mapping_bits for more control. This is a wrapper around cvmx_core_add_wired_tlb_entry()

Parameters:
vaddr Virtual address to map
page0_addr page 0 physical address
page1_addr page1 physical address
page_mask page mask.
Returns:
Success: TLB index used (0-31) Failure: -1
int cvmx_core_add_fixed_tlb_mapping_bits ( uint64_t  vaddr,
uint64_t  page0_addr,
uint64_t  page1_addr,
cvmx_tlb_pagemask_t  page_mask 
)

Adds a fixed (wired) TLB mapping.

Returns TLB index used or -1 on error. This is a wrapper around cvmx_core_add_wired_tlb_entry()

Parameters:
vaddr Virtual address to map
page0_addr page 0 physical address, with low 3 bits representing the DIRTY, VALID, and GLOBAL bits
page1_addr page1 physical address, with low 3 bits representing the DIRTY, VALID, and GLOBAL bits
page_mask page mask.
Returns:
Success: TLB index used (0-31) Failure: -1
int cvmx_core_add_wired_tlb_entry ( uint64_t  hi,
uint64_t  lo0,
uint64_t  lo1,
cvmx_tlb_pagemask_t  page_mask 
)

Adds a wired TLB entry, and returns the index of the entry added.

Parameters are written to TLB registers without further processing.

Parameters:
hi HI register value
lo0 lo0 register value
lo1 lo1 register value
page_mask pagemask register value
Returns:
Success: TLB index used (0-31 Octeon, 0-63 Octeon+, or 0-127 Octeon2). Failure: -1
static int cvmx_core_get_tlb_entries ( void   )  [inline, static]

Return number of TLB entries.

Generated on 27 Oct 2017 for Octeon Software Development Kit by  1.6.1
